attributes.action: Stop Sharia Law from being binding in law under arbitration tribunals rules
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: sharia law can be enforced in this country by the county and high courts.   This is allowed under rules of arbitration when both parties in the dispute agree to give the tribunal (in this case a sharia court) the power to rule on the case.  We state that this should be stopped, as sharia law is totally contrary to western values of fair and equal justice for all.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Stop Sharia Law from being binding in law under arbitration tribunals rules."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page18913
